When feeling, taste, and genius all conspire</br>To claim the undisputed meed of praise,</br>In vain, where all must envy or admire,</br>The feeble tribute of applause we raise.
For who shall paint her worth, whose matchless mind</br>Warm with the elegance of classic lore,</br>By reason strengthen'd, and by love refin'd,</br>Divides the palm which Spenser own'd before?

Blest page!  where, whilst the varied graces shine,</br>Fair Virtue wears her most attractive hues,</br>Where glowing Wisdom stamps th' impressive line,</br>And Truth entwines the flowers which Fancy strews.
'Tis thine to bid incautious virtue fly</br>The paths, where fell deceits in ambush move,</br>Ambition's lure, Suspicion's venom'd eye;—</br>—And prize the calmer sweets of social love.
For thee, sweet muse, whose artless strains display</br>Each chaste affection of the female heart,</br>Thine are the joys which never can decay,</br>The joys which virtue, science, truth impart.
These, while the lighter pleasures of the hour</br>A sickly gleam of dubious rapture cast,</br>Shall yield their soft, consolatory power</br>To bless the future, and endear the past.</br>
